com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.comb

Class ClockwiseComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.comb.ClockwiseComparator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparator<DirectedEdge>

    public final class ClockwiseComparator
extends Object
implements Comparator<DirectedEdge>
    Comparator that orders DirectedEdges in clock-wise order given a center Vertex.

    The order is determined by computing the cross product of vectors:

    • (v, a)
    • (v, c)

    Refer to LocalRotations interface definition for more info on notation used.

    See Also:
    [SO] Sort points in clockwise order?

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public int compare(DirectedEdge e1,
                   DirectedEdge e2)
        Compares clock pointers (v, a) and (v, c), where v is the center Vertex of this comparator.

        If clock pointers are directly opposite to one another, then e1 is considered to be strictly greater than e2.

        Refer to LocalRotations interface definition for more info on notation used.

        Note: this comparator imposes orderings that are inconsistent with equals.

        Specified by:
        compare in interface Comparator<DirectedEdge>
        Parameters:
        e1 - DirectedEdge (a, b)
        e2 - DirectedEdge (c, d)
